creator: Mega-Wa-Blamicus
title: Basic Thinking Facial Expression Animation
description: This is a step-by-step, frame-by-frame tutorial to help you figure out how to animate a thinking character with expressive facial features.
steps: Draw the character in its most basic forms, avoiding details initially to focus on movement.
Anticipate the character's movement by having it look slightly upward and towards the viewer, using a crosshair as a guide.
Continue the motion with several similar frames, ensuring smooth transitions, and start moving the arm forward.
Bring the arm upwards towards the face while continuing to smooth the facial motion.
Exaggerate the downward movement by dragging the face, head, and hair down, and begin hunching the character over.
Make the character blink when changing direction to avoid visual overload and create an interesting transition.
Illustrate facial squish by drawing lines where the fingers press into the cheeks.
Let the movement come to a stop gradually, allowing the hair to fall into place and the other arm to support the elbow.
Let the final frame stay still for several frames to emphasize that the character is thinking.
